Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Quantum computers are still not capable to break SHA256 algo

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: or any crypto algo as said by experts

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: but we can sure expect that day come soon 😄

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Last time i read SHA1 was the only one being 100% breakable not sure if thing evolved further since

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: yea, heard similar too

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: <https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Quantum_computing_and_Bitcoin#QC_attacks>

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Unless I read that quantum paper wrong (which is quite possible) they were using a QC to verify that quantum noise was actually randomly distributed, which the verification would take a regular computer a long ass time to verify... that hardly sounds like quantum supremacy to me. Though I guess if you count verifying random noise is random, as a "hard problem" then yea, guess it took the title there

Author: Monstar#8630
Content:
Hi guys, 
I am new here and have just read the "How to make a blockchain" article.
https://komodoplatform.com/how-to-make-a-blockchain/
I have got 2 questions. 

"Step 13: Pay For Your Smart Chain. 
Now, it’s time to pay for your Smart Chain. You can pay with fiat currency via PayPal or you can pay with cryptocurrency via CoinPayments. Watch the video tutorial here to learn more about paying with cryptocurrency."

- Who does the money for creating the Smart Chain go to?
- How does anyone investing in Komodo coin (like me - small investor) profit from this?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: It depends what modules you paid for, explorer an SPV server costs goes to the person that runs the explorers, to cover server costs. same as dPow, it goes to fund dPow itself, DEX listing fee goes to DEX dev fund, and so on

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: `How does anyone investing in Komodo coin (like me - small investor) profit from this?` I don't really understand this question, are you asking how do you profit from creating a SmartChain?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: There is one thing for sure, the 5% APR reward for holding and using KMD is a nice profit on it's own

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: Alternatively, the the more the platform tech is adopted and utilized is the more likely that the value of your investment will grow

Author: Monstar#8630
Content: @oszy Thanks. The second part of my question was basically meant like "what is the reason/need for someone to buy and use Komodo in creating a his own blockchain"? Do people need to buy Komodo for any eason?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @Monstar  yes for DPoW , and eventually use of sidechains attached to the mainchain to provide other functionality.

Author: Monstar#8630
Content: Thanks for the explanation.

Author: Goku#9007
Content: Hello

Author: Goku#9007
Content: I have a question regarding binance staking

Author: Goku#9007
Content: Do the community from komodo think that is good or bad?

Author: Bernz - Selling LABS#9130
Content: I'd advise against holding it on Binance unless you're actively trading KMD.. it's nice that rewards are getting distributed to their respective owners however you are still putting your faith in Binance.. Not your keys not your coins!  I think it's good for marketing and that's about it

Author: Goku#9007
Content: Did binance activate komodo staking with the consens of the komodo devs?

Author: Bernz - Selling LABS#9130
Content: I believe the Komodo team had been advocating for it

Author: gcharang#6833
Oszy#5734
Content: it is not staking and it didn't have to be activated

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: they were always accumulating rewards, but never distributed it back to the people until now

Author: Goku#9007
Content:
I am not familiar with komodo but if you have governance on chain, does binance not have a big impact on it?
 Could it not harm the network?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: It's not different in any way from someone holding 2 million kmd in a wallet, or binance does. rewards will be the same. they never dumped it, they gave it back to us, and will continue to do so.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: I see no harm in giving people what's practically theirs.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: Your own wallet, or on binance,  you get same rewards. Why would you keep it on binance unless you trading actively?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: From their perspective they want people to trade on their platform not using them as a wallet, so they don't really have any profit or advantage getting people deposit more and more kmd there.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
the only thing in our ecosystem that comes close to governance is the election of Notary nodes by KMD holders every year
30 Notary nodes stand for election each year
last year the lowest amount of Votes received by an elected candidate was around 1 million
I'am not sure how many KMD, binance controls, but you can estimate the number of candidates they will be able to elect
but the notary system has redundany built in and only used for backing up KMD data to BTC and smart chains to KMD, they can't do any harm
@Goku

Content: coin emission for KMD: <https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/coin-emission.html>
